attribute.name: account
attribute.description: Charge resources used by this job to specified account. (-A, --account=<account>)
attribute.tooltip: The account is an arbitrary string. The account name may be changed after job submission using the scontrol command.

attribute.name: begin
attribute.description: Defer the allocation of the job until the specified time. (--begin<time>)
attribute.tooltip: Submit the batch script to the SLURM controller immediately, like normal, but tell the controller to defer the allocation of the job until the specified time. Time may be of the form HH:MM:SS to run a job at a specific time of day (seconds are optional). (If that time is already past, the next day is assumed.) You may also specify midnight, noon, or teatime (4pm) and you can have a time-of-day suffixed with AM or PM for running in the morning or the evening. You can also say what day the job runs by specifying a date of the form MMDDYY or MM/DD/YY or YYYY-MM-DD. Combine date and time using the following format YYYY-MM-DD[HH:MM[:SS]]. You can also give times like "now" + count time-units, where the time-units can be seconds (default), minutes, hours, days, or weeks and you can tell SLURM to run the job today with the keyword "today" and to run the job tomorrow with the keyword "tomorrow". The value may be changed after job submission using the scontrol command.

attribute.name: comment
attribute.description: An arbitrary comment. (--comment<string>)
attribute.tooltip: An arbitrary comment enclosed in double quotes if using spaces or some special characters.

attribute.name: dependency
attribute.description: Defer the start of this job until the specified dependencies have been satisfied completed. (-d, --dependency=<dependency_list>)
attribute.tooltip: Format is of the form "type:job_id[:job_id][,type:job_id[:job_id]]. Many jobs can share the same dependency and these jobs may even belong to different users. The value may be changed after job submission using the scontrol command.

attribute.name: error
attribute.description: Instruct SLURM to connect the batch script's standard error directly to the file name specified in the "filename pattern". (-e, --error=<filename_pattern>)
attribute.tooltip: By default both standard output and standard error are directed to a file of the name "slurm-%j.out", where the "%j" is replaced with the job allocation number. See the "--input" option for filename specification options. Use absolute path or "${ptp_rm:workdir#value}" prefix to be relative to working directory.

validator.error-message: "error" field: Use absolute path or "${ptp_rm:workdir#value}" prefix to be relative to working directory.

attribute.name: exclude
attribute.description: Specify what nodes to exclude. (-x, --exclude=<node name list>)
attribute.tooltip: Explicitly exclude certain nodes from the resources granted to the job.

attribute.name: hold
attribute.description: Specify the job is to be submitted in a held state (priority of zero). (-H, --hold)
attribute.tooltip: A held job can now be released using scontrol to reset its priority (e.g. "scontrol update jobid=<id> priority=1").

attribute.name: immediate
attribute.description: The batch script is only submitted to the controller if the resources necessary to grant its job allocation are immediately available. (-I, --immediate)
attribute.tooltip: If the job allocation has to wait in a queue of pending jobs, the batch script is not submitted.

attribute.name: input
attribute.description: Specify filename pattern of batch script's standard input. (-i, --input=<filename_pattern>)
attribute.tooltip: Instruct SLURM to connect the batch script's standard input directly to the file name specified in the "filename pattern". By default, "/dev/null" is open on the batch script's standard input and both standard output and standard error are directed to a file of the name "slurm-%j.out", where the "%j" is replaced with the job allocation number, as described below. The filename pattern may contain one or more replacement symbols, which are a percent sign "%" followed by a letter (e.g. %j). Supported replacement symbols are: (1) %j - Job allocation number. (2) %N - Node name. Only one file is created, so %N will be replaced by the name of the first node in the job, which is the one that runs the script.

attribute.name: job_name
attribute.description: Specify a name for the job allocation. (-J, --job-name=<jobname>)
attribute.tooltip: The specified name appears along with the job id number when querying running jobs on the system. The default is the name of the batch script, or just "sbatch" if the script is read on sbatch's standard input.

validator.error-message: "job_name" field: Must be at least one alphanumeric character

attribute.name: mail_type
attribute.description: Notify user by email when certain event types occur. (--mail-type=<type>)
attribute.tooltip: Valid type values are BEGIN, END, FAIL, REQUEUE, and ALL (any state change). The user to be notified is indicated with --mail-user.

attribute.name: mail_user
attribute.description: User to receive email notification of state changes. (--mail_user=<user>)
attribute.tooltip: As defined by --mail-type. The default value is the submitting user.

attribute.name: nodefile
attribute.description: Specify filename containing nodes. (-F, --nodefile=<node file>)
attribute.tooltip: Much like --nodelist, but the list is contained in a file of name node file. The node names of the list may also span multiple lines in the file. Duplicate node names in the file will be ignored. The order of the node names in the list is not important; the node names will be sorted by SLURM.

attribute.name: nodelist
attribute.description: Request a specific list of node names. (-w, --nodelist=<node name list>)
attribute.tooltip: Request a specific list of node names. The list may be specified as a comma-separated list of node names, or a range of node names (e.g. mynode[1-5,7,...]). Duplicate node names in the list will be ignored. The order of the node names in the list is not important; the node names will be sorted by SLURM.

attribute.name: nodes
attribute.description: Request that a minimum of "minnodes" nodes be allocated to this job. (-N, --nodes=<minnodes[-maxnodes]>)
attribute.tooltip: The scheduler may decide to launch the job on more than "minnodes" nodes. A limit on the maximum node count may be specified with "maxnodes" (e.g. "--nodes=2-4"). The minimum and maximum node count may be the same to specify a specific number of nodes (e.g. "--nodes=2-2" asks for two and ONLY two nodes). The partition's node limits supersede those of the job. If a job's node limits are outside of the range permitted for its associated partition, the job is left in a PENDING state. This permits possible execution at a later time, when the partition limit is changed. If a job node limit exceeds the number of nodes configured in the partition, the job is rejected. Note that the environment variable SLURM_NNODES are set to the count of nodes actually allocated to the job. See the ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES section for more information. If "-N" is not specified, the default behavior is to allocate enough nodes to satisfy the requirements of the "-n" and "-c" options. The job is allocated as many nodes as possible within the range specified and without delaying the initiation of the job.

attribute.name: ntasks
attribute.description: Specify the number of tasks to run. (-n, --ntasks=<number>)
attribute.tooltip: Allocate resources for ntasks tasks. The default is one task per node, but note that the --ntasks-per-node option changes this default.

attribute.name: ntasks_per_node
attribute.description: Request the maximum ntasks be invoked on each node. (--ntasks-per-node=<ntasks>)
attribute.tooltip: Meant to be used with the --nodes option. This is related to --cpus-per-task=ncpus, but does not require knowledge of the actual number of cpus on each node. In some cases, it is more convenient to be able to request that no more than a specific number of tasks be invoked on each node. Examples of this include submitting a hybrid MPI/OpenMP app where only one MPI "task/rank" should be assigned to each node while allowing the OpenMP portion to utilize all of the parallelism present in the node, or submitting a single setup/cleanup/monitoring job to each node of a pre-existing allocation as one step in a larger job script.

attribute.name: open_mode
attribute.description: Open the output and error files using append or truncate mode as specified. (--open_mode=append|truncate)
attribute.tooltip: The default value is specified by the system configuration parameter JobFileAppend.

attribute.name: output
attribute.description: Instruct SLURM to connect the batch script's standard output directly to the file name specified in the "filename pattern". (-o, --output=<filename_pattern>)
attribute.tooltip: By default both standard output and standard error are directed to a file of the name "slurm-%j.out", where the "%j" is replaced with the job allocation number. See the --input option for filename specification options. Use absolute path or "${ptp_rm:workdir#value}" prefix to be relative to working directory.

validator.error-message: "output" field: Use absolute path or "${ptp_rm:workdir#value}" prefix to be relative to working directory.

attribute.name: partition
attribute.description: Request a specific partition for the resource allocation. (-p, --partition=<partition_names>)
attribute.tooltip: If not specified, the default behaviour is to allow the slurm controller to select the default partition as designated by the system administrator. If the job can use more than one partition, specify their names in a comma separate list and the one offering earliest initiation is used.

attribute.name: quiet
attribute.description: Suppress informational messages from sbatch. (-Q, --quiet)
attribute.tooltip: Errors are still displayed.

attribute.name: reservation
attribute.description: Allocate resources for the job from the named reservation. (--reservation=<name>)

attribute.name: time
attribute.description: Set a limit on the total run time of the job allocation. (-t, --time=<time>)
attribute.tooltip: If the requested time limit exceeds the partition's time limit, the job is left in a PENDING state (possibly indefinitely). The default time limit is the partition's time limit. When the time limit is reached, each task in each job step is sent SIGTERM followed by SIGKILL. The interval between signals is specified by the SLURM configuration parameter "KillWait". A time limit of zero requests that no time limit be imposed. Acceptable time formats include "minutes", "minutes:seconds", "hours:minutes:seconds", "days-hours", "days-hours:minutes" and "days-hours:minutes:seconds".

attribute.name: time_min
attribute.description: Set a minimum time limit on the job allocation. (--time-min=<time>)
attribute.tooltip: Set a minimum time limit on the job allocation. If specified, the job may have it's --time limit lowered to a value no lower than --time-min if doing so permits the job to begin execution earlier than otherwise possible. The job's time limit will not be changed after the job is allocated resources. This is performed by a backfill scheduling algorithm to allocate resources otherwise reserved for higher priority jobs. Acceptable time formats include "minutes", "minutes:seconds", "hours:minutes:seconds", "days-hours", "days-hours:minutes" and "days-hours:minutes:seconds".

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Increase the verbosity of sbatch's informational messages. (-v, --verbose)
attribute.tooltip: Multiple -v's further increase sbatch's verbosity. By default only errors are displayed.

attribute.name: workdir
attribute.description: Set the working directory of the batch script to "directory" before it it executed. (-D, --workdir=<directory>)
attribute.tooltip: Must use absolute path on scheduled system, or "${ptp_rm:directory#value}".

validator.error-message: "workdir" field: Must use absolute path on scheduled system, or "${ptp_rm:directory#value}".

attribute.name: MIC_OMP_NUM_THREADS
attribute.description: Number of MIC OpenMP threads per task. (export MIC_OMP_NUM_THREADS=<n>)
attribute.tooltip: Set the number of MIC OpenMP threads per task

attribute.name: MIC_PPN
attribute.description: Number of MPI tasks per MIC. (export MIC_PPN=<n>)
attribute.tooltip: Set the number of MPI tasks per MIC.

attribute.name: OMP_NUM_THREADS
attribute.description: Number of OpenMP threads. (export OMP_NUM_THREADS=<n>)
attribute.tooltip: Number of OpenMP threads.

attribute.name: run.command
attribute.description: The prefix command used to launch the application (e.g. "ibrun ./a.out").
attribute.tooltip: The prefix command to use with this executable. Specify no prefix command for serial, OpenMP (host only or MIC only), or offload code.

browse.title: Browse
browse.tooltip: Clear text box if "Browse" button does not work. ${ptp_rm:workdir#tooltip}
